unnormalised: Heavy traffic was reported on the Mumbai-Pune expressway this morning, 12/07/2024, due to a landslide near Lonavala. Commuters faced delays of up to 2 hrs. Several buses, including those operated by MSRTC, were diverted via the old Mumbai-Pune highway, adding significantly to travel times.
normalised: Heavy traffic was reported on the Mumbai Pune expressway this morning, twelfth july two thousand and twenty four, due to a landslide near Lonavala. Commuters faced delays of up to two hours. Several buses, including those operated by M-S-R-T-C, were diverted via the old Mumbai Pune highway, adding significantly to travel times.

unnormalised: Sources indicated that the landslide occurred at approximately 6:00 AM IST, blocking 2 lanes of the expressway. Authorities, including the Maharashtra Highway Police and local disaster management teams, were immediately dispatched to the scene. Initial estimates suggested that clearing the debris could take up to 4-5 hrs. Many travellers en route to their weekend getaways in destinations like Mahabaleshwar faced unexpected detours. The Pune-Mumbai distance is normally covered in about 3 hrs, but today it's taking much longer.
normalised: Sources indicated that the landslide occurred at approximately six AM I-S-T, blocking two lanes of the expressway. Authorities, including the Maharashtra Highway Police and local disaster management teams, were immediately dispatched to the scene. Initial estimates suggested that clearing the debris could take up to four to five hours. Many travellers en route to their weekend getaways in destinations like Mahabaleshwar faced unexpected detours. The Pune Mumbai distance is normally covered in about three hours, but today it is taking much longer.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, within Pune city, auto-rickshaw unions have called for a strike, demanding a fare hike of Rs. 5 per km. This is expected to cause considerable inconvenience to locals relying on this mode of transport, particularly during the peak hours of 8 AM-11 AM and 5 PM-8 PM. Commuters are advised to consider using alternative options like Ola/Uber or the local bus service.
normalised: Meanwhile, within Pune city, auto-rickshaw unions have called for a strike, demanding a fare hike of rupees five per kilometer. This is expected to cause considerable inconvenience to locals relying on this mode of transport, particularly during the peak hours of eight A-M eleven A-M and five P-M eight P-M. Commuters are advised to consider using alternative options like Ola slash Uber or the local bus service.
